content:
• Wednesday, November 2, 2011
  • EVLV

    ValueVision Media (VVTV) plummets in post-session trading after cutting its Q3 guidance, now...

    ValueVision Media (VVTV) plummets in post-session trading after cutting its Q3 guidance, now expecting a loss between $700K - $500K, compared to a $600K gain the year prior. Sales are expected to be around $135M, below Street estimates of $144M. Shares -20% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:04 PM
  • DNDN

    Shares of Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN) are getting hammered in the post-trading session, despite...

    Shares of Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN) are getting hammered in the post-trading session, despite reporting FQ4 earnings that largely beat estimates. The company forecasts only modest sales growth for Provenge, its blockbuster prostate cancer vaccine, over the next several quarters. Shares -22.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM | 4 Comments
  • MELI

    Latin American auction site MercadoLibre (NASDAQ:MELI) gains 15.1% AH after reporting Q3 revenue...

    Latin American auction site MercadoLibre (NASDAQ:MELI) gains 15.1% AH after reporting Q3 revenue of $81.6M (+46% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.60, beating consensus by $2.9M and $0.17. Gross merchandise volume grew 52% Y/Y, and registered users increased 28%. The company's payments business saw volume increase 94% Y/Y, and transactions grow 103%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • RLD

    3D glasses maker RealD (NYSE:RLD), already hit hard by bad news this fall (I, II), drops 13.3%...

    3D glasses maker RealD (NYSE:RLD), already hit hard by bad news this fall (I, II), drops 13.3% AH after reporting FQ2 revenue of $88M (+35% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.33; the latter beat by $0.11, but the former missed by $6.4M. In addition, the company says Samsung has abandoned plans to make 3D LCD panels using RealD's technology.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO) gains 13.3% AH after reporting FQ1 revenue of $74.4M (+175% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO) gains 13.3% AH after reporting FQ1 revenue of $74.4M (+175% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.15, blowing past consensus by $10.3M and $0.12. The company is now guiding for FY12 revenue growth of 55%, above prior guidance of 40%, and lifting its operating margin guidance range to 6%-8% (5%-7% prior). (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • Z

    Along with earnings, Zillow (NASDAQ:Z) announces the purchase of Diverse Solutions - a company...

    Along with earnings, Zillow (NASDAQ:Z) announces the purchase of Diverse Solutions - a company that helps agents market their businesses and improve their websites - for $7.8M in cash and stock. Shares +6.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • Z

    Zillow (NASDAQ:Z): Q3 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $68.1M (+44% Y/Y) beats by $100K....

    Zillow (NASDAQ:Z): Q3 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $68.1M (+44% Y/Y) beats by $100K. Shares +7.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • RIG

    Transocean (NYSE:RIG): Q3 EPS of $0.03 misses by $0.76. Revenue of $2.24B (-4% Y/Y) misses by...

    Transocean (NYSE:RIG): Q3 EPS of $0.03 misses by $0.76. Revenue of $2.24B (-4% Y/Y) misses by $120M. Shares -4.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • QCOM

    More on Qualcomm's FQ4: 127M baseband chips shipped in FQ4,+14% Y/Y. $142M in shares...

    More on Qualcomm's FQ4: 127M baseband chips shipped in FQ4,+14% Y/Y. $142M in shares repurchased. Free cash flow was $1.69B (above net income of $1.37B). ASP for royalty-bearing devices was $204-$210, down slightly Q/Q; ASP expected to be $197-$209 in FY12. Shipments of royalty-bearing devices expected to grow 16% in 2012, to ~900M units. QCOM +8.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • PRU

    Prudential (NYSE:PRU): Q3 EPS of $1.07 misses by $0.47. Revenue of $9.95B (+0.4% Y/Y) misses by...

    Prudential (NYSE:PRU): Q3 EPS of $1.07 misses by $0.47. Revenue of $9.95B (+0.4% Y/Y) misses by $63M. Shares -1.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR): Q3 EPS of -$0.54 misses by $0.14. Revenue of $332.2M (+134% Y/Y) beats by...

    Clearwire (CLWR): Q3 EPS of -$0.54 misses by $0.14. Revenue of $332.2M (+134% Y/Y) beats by $5.2M. Company expects to exceed prior guidance for 10M subscribers by year's end. Shares -0.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • QGEN

    Qiagen (NASDAQ:QGEN): Q3 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $289M (+5% Y/Y) misses by $1M. (PR)

    Qiagen (NASDAQ:QGEN): Q3 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $289M (+5% Y/Y) misses by $1M. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • QCOM

    Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM): FQ4 EPS of $0.80 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $4.12B (+39% Y/Y) beats by...

    Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM): FQ4 EPS of $0.80 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $4.12B (+39% Y/Y) beats by $120M. Company expects FY12 revenue of $18B-$19B vs. $17.3B consensus. Expects FY12 EPS of $3.42-$3.62 vs. $3.48 consensus. Shares +6.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • ATML

    Atmel (ATML -1.1%) underperforms after missing Q3 revenue forecasts and guiding on its CC for a...

    Atmel (ATML -1.1%) underperforms after missing Q3 revenue forecasts and guiding on its CC for a 12%-16% Q/Q revenue decline. Though "downgrading" shares to Buy from Strong Buy, Needham is still high on Atmel's dominant position in a capacitive touchscreen controller market that's expected to keep growing on the back of smartphone and tablet demand.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • TMUS

    MetroPCS (PCS +11.1%) recoups yesterday's big loss as JPMorgan upgrades the pay-as-you-go...

    MetroPCS (PCS +11.1%) recoups yesterday's big loss as JPMorgan upgrades the pay-as-you-go wireless carrier, along with rival Leap Wireless (LEAP +4%). Q3 subscriber performance for both was better than expected, JPM says, and PCS should see higher customer growth with its Q4 promotion of four lines for $100/month. Leap could sell excess spectrum "worth up to $150M-$250M."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • PWR

    Shares of Quanta Services (PWR +10%) trade higher after TransCanada Corporation (TRP -0.3%)...

    Shares of Quanta Services (PWR +10%) trade higher after TransCanada Corporation (TRP -0.3%) selects one of its subsidiaries to be part of a joint venture that will build 1,179 miles of pipeline for the TransCanada Keystone XL Pipeline project.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • MPC

    Marathon Petroleum (MPC +6.3%) outperforms for a second day following its Q3 beat, perhaps...

    Marathon Petroleum (MPC +6.3%) outperforms for a second day following its Q3 beat, perhaps thanks to a bullish note from Barclays. The firm thinks investors may have overestimated the oil refiner's exposure to WTI oil prices, and thus underestimated its earnings power.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • WCG

    WellsCare Group (WCG +11.5%) gains after the firm beats earnings estimates and significantly...

    WellsCare Group (WCG +11.5%) gains after the firm beats earnings estimates and significantly raises its full-year EPS guidance as it records a "favorable development" of prior years medical benefits payable and sees an improved outlook for Q4. The company reiterates 2011 Medicaid segment MBR will fall below the 2010 MBR.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • NORNQ

    Noranda Aluminum (NOR +22.4%) takes off after reporting Q3 revenue of $400.4M (+27% Y/Y) and EPS...

    Noranda Aluminum (NOR +22.4%) takes off after reporting Q3 revenue of $400.4M (+27% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.45, blowing past consensus by $36.4M and $0.22, and forecasting 2012 demand to be similar to 2011 levels. In addition, Noranda is declaring its first quarterly dividend ($0.03/share), as well a $1/share special dividend. Rising in sympathy: AA +3.3%. CENX +5.1%. ACH +9.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • DISCA

    Discovery Communications (NASDAQ:DISCA) is up 3.2% following yesterday's Q3 beat and guidance...

    Discovery Communications (NASDAQ:DISCA) is up 3.2% following yesterday's Q3 beat and guidance hike, fueled in part by the revenue obtained from its licensing deal with Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX). UBS estimates the Netflix deal padded Discovery's OIBDA by $0.11/share, and will boost Discovery's U.S. distribution revenue growth by 200-300 bps over the next 7 quarters. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • AMFW

    Foster Wheeler (FWLT -8.3%) takes a hit after its Q3 misses consensus estimates. Net income fell...

    Foster Wheeler (FWLT -8.3%) takes a hit after its Q3 misses consensus estimates. Net income fell 29% Y/Y, as higher expenses masked improved revenue and growth in the company's power and engineering businesses.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • RVBD

    JMP Securities initiates coverage of networking stocks Riverbed (RVBD +6.3%), F5 (FFIV +3.5%),...

    JMP Securities initiates coverage of networking stocks Riverbed (RVBD +6.3%), F5 (FFIV +3.5%), Aruba (ARUN +0.3%), Fortinet (FTNT +0.4%) and Brocade (BRCD +5%) at Outperform, and Cisco (CSCO +0.9%) at Market Perform. Riverbed faces several tech trends propelling long-term growth in the WAN optimization market it already dominates, JMP says.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • HUN

    Shares of Huntsman (HUN +12.4%) trade higher after beating Q3 estimates on solid profit from its...

    Shares of Huntsman (HUN +12.4%) trade higher after beating Q3 estimates on solid profit from its polyurethanes business. Revenue rose 24% Y/Y, boosted by a 20% jump in product selling prices, as the company sees demand rebound and a recovery in the manufacturing industry.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • MA

    MasterCard (MA +5.8%) crushed Q3 estimates, as gross dollar volume of transactions made with its...

    MasterCard (MA +5.8%) crushed Q3 estimates, as gross dollar volume of transactions made with its cards increased 18.1% and total transactions rose 20.5%. The concern for the U.S. economy is that the surge in credit card use will lead to a similar uptick in delinquencies and defaults. Credit card use is far outstripping debit card use, possibly indicating that consumers didn’t have the cash.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM | 4 Comments
  • NLC

    Water treatment firm Nalco Holding (NLC +1.6%) trades up after its Q3 beat Street estimates....

    Water treatment firm Nalco Holding (NLC +1.6%) trades up after its Q3 beat Street estimates. Earnings jumped 30%, surpassing already strong prior-year results. Sales and profit grew in all segments and regions. The company raises its FY11 guidance, now expecting $1.75 per share, up from its earlier projection of $1.70 in August.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • PEET

    Peet's Coffee (PEET -4.9%) sells off following its Q3 report. Revenue of $91.2M (+14% Y/Y) and...

    Peet's Coffee (PEET -4.9%) sells off following its Q3 report. Revenue of $91.2M (+14% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.28 beat by $1.5M and $0.01, with growth driven by a 38% increase in grocery sales. However, Peet's guidance for 2011 EPS of $1.40-$1.50 ($1.50 consensus) and 2012 EPS of $1.70-$1.80 ($1.80 consensus) isn't being received well. Also moving lower: GMCR -2%. DNKN -1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • PBI

    Pitney Bowes (PBI -4.4%) dips after its Q3 revenue comes up short of estimates. Earnings soared...

    Pitney Bowes (PBI -4.4%) dips after its Q3 revenue comes up short of estimates. Earnings soared 94% Y/Y, primarily from a one-time tax benefit, but sales lagged in its two main units - business services and equipment sales - due to continuing soft demand for traditional mail products.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • FELE

    Electronic components manufacturer Franklin Electric (FELE +13%) ramps higher after its Q3...

    Electronic components manufacturer Franklin Electric (FELE +13%) ramps higher after its Q3 results topped estimates. Revenue jumped 19% Y/Y, as rising raw materials costs were largely offset by labor productivity improvements, fixed cost controls and better operating leverage.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM
  • PAG

    Shares of Penske Automotive Group (NYSE:PAG) shoot up 9.6% after the automotive retailer shows...

    Shares of Penske Automotive Group (NYSE:PAG) shoot up 9.6% after the automotive retailer shows better-than-expected Q3 profits led by a 16% Y/Y gain in used unit retail sales. CEO Roger Penske says the firm should fully recover to normal production in Q1 after the Japan natural disaster disrupted the supply chain since March.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • UUP

    In the hour since the FOMC statement, stocks have moved to session lows, though still higher on...

    In the hour since the FOMC statement, stocks have moved to session lows, though still higher on the day. S&P 500 +0.8%, Nasdaq +0.3%. As night follows day, the greenback moves higher, the dollar index erasing nearly all of a more than 1% loss. UUP -0.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • MGIC

    Magic Software (MGIC +9%) pops after its Q3 beat consensus across the board. Revenue rose 33%...

    Magic Software (MGIC +9%) pops after its Q3 beat consensus across the board. Revenue rose 33% Y/Y, as the company racks up its eighth consecutive quarter of growth on heavy demand for its cloud-based application platform.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • LVLT

    Level 3 (LVLT -9.8%) takes a hit in spite of its Q3 beating estimates. The company reported...

    Level 3 (LVLT -9.8%) takes a hit in spite of its Q3 beating estimates. The company reported revenue of $947M for the quarter, which was better than Street expectations of $912M, but the company disappointed on a per share basis, posting a wider Y/Y EPS loss of $1.47 due to higher interest expenses and acquistion costs related to its Global Crossing transaction.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM | 2 Comments
  • ENDP

    Endo Pharmaceuticals (ENDP +1.5%) gains after receiving FDA approval for its Felodipine...

    Endo Pharmaceuticals (ENDP +1.5%) gains after receiving FDA approval for its Felodipine extended-release tablets, a generic version of AstraZeneca's (AZN +0.3%) Plendil blood pressure medication.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • CVX

    Shares of Chevron (CVX +2%) are trading higher as the company begins drilling its first shale...

    Shares of Chevron (CVX +2%) are trading higher as the company begins drilling its first shale gas exploration well in Poland. The drilling is the first of four projects the company has licensed to develop in the southeastern portion of the country.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM -2.3%) shares have hit a 7-year low, leading the company to trade below...

    Research In Motion (RIMM -2.3%) shares have hit a 7-year low, leading the company to trade below book value. Jaguar Financial and others have cited RIM's depressed stock price as evidence its oft-criticized management needs to sell the company, but the inability of RIM's products to align well with the roadmaps of major industry players is likely to remain an issue.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM | 6 Comments
  • BHE

    Benchmark Electronics (BHE +2.7%) trades higher after announcing it's successfully restarted its...

    Benchmark Electronics (BHE +2.7%) trades higher after announcing it's successfully restarted its Korat, Thailand facility as part of its Emergency Management Business Continuity Plan. The idle facility was put into operation after the company's main manufacturing facility in Ayudhaya was shut down due to flooding.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • SAM

    Boston Beer (NYSE:SAM) rises 14.2% after taking on an upgrade from Credit Agricole following the...

    Boston Beer (NYSE:SAM) rises 14.2% after taking on an upgrade from Credit Agricole following the brewer's Q3 revenue and profit beat. Analysts with the firm set a lofty $109 price target on shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • EMR

    Emerson Electric (EMR +3%) moves higher after Credit Suisse raises its estimates on the company,...

    Emerson Electric (EMR +3%) moves higher after Credit Suisse raises its estimates on the company, saying the stock has the propensity to grow its  top-line and warrants a premium multiple.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • INSG

    3G/4G modem vendor Novatel (NVTL -16.5%) gets hammered following an uneven Q3 report. While...

    3G/4G modem vendor Novatel (NVTL -16.5%) gets hammered following an uneven Q3 report. While revenue of $113.3M (+50% Y/Y) and breakeven EPS beat consensus by $0.3M and $0.08, Novatel is guiding for Q4 revenue of $105M-$120M and EPS of -$0.10 to $0.00, below a consensus of $122.7M and $0.02. Thai flooding is expected to impact Q4 sales by $3M-$4M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • AOL

    AOL's (AOL +12.1%) financials seem to portray a company in dismal shape: Sales sank 6%, and it...

    AOL's (AOL +12.1%) financials seem to portray a company in dismal shape: Sales sank 6%, and it lost $2.6M in Q3. But investors believe less bad is good, as quarterly revenue declines were the lowest in five years, and search ad sales fell by the smallest in two years. "The strategy is working," one analyst says. "They have some interesting ad platforms that are gaining traction."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • RBA

    Ritchie Bros. (RBA +2.9%), the world's largest on-site and online industrial auctioneer, gains...

    Ritchie Bros. (RBA +2.9%), the world's largest on-site and online industrial auctioneer, gains after saying it's reached and exceeded $5B of online equipment sales in the current quarter. Separately, Robert Baird upgrades the stock to Outperform on valuation.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • VIAV

    JDS Uniphase's (JDSU +9.2%) FQ1 report is fueling a massive rally in optical component stocks,...

    JDS Uniphase's (JDSU +9.2%) FQ1 report is fueling a massive rally in optical component stocks, as the company's better-than-feared guidance goes over well with investors spooked by Thai flooding. CC comments about "significant improvements" in customer inventory levels might also be helping. FNSR +12.2%. OCLR +6.5%. OPLK +5.9%. EMKR +11.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • TAP

    Molson Coors Brewing (TAP -3.4%) dips after its Q3 EPS falls short of the mark. Earnings fell...

    Molson Coors Brewing (TAP -3.4%) dips after its Q3 EPS falls short of the mark. Earnings fell 23% Y/Y due to lower volume and cost inflation. High unemployment has affected beer sales across developed markets, forcing the company to cut operating costs in order to shore up its bottom line. Gross margin fell to 42.3% from 47.7% as throughput costs rose 20%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • HGG

    Electronics retailer hhgregg (HGG +20%) skyrockets after reporting FQ2 revenue of $618.6M (+45%...

    Electronics retailer hhgregg (HGG +20%) skyrockets after reporting FQ2 revenue of $618.6M (+45% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.16, soundly beating consensus by $76M and $0.10. Same-store sales rose 1.5% - much of the company's revenue growth came from new store openings. Hhgregg is lifting its FY12 EPS guidance range to $1.26-$1.41, from a prior range of $1.20-$1.35.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • BID

    Shares of Sotheby's (NYSE:BID) move 4.9% lower as its Q3 earnings release approaches and the...

    Shares of Sotheby's (NYSE:BID) move 4.9% lower as its Q3 earnings release approaches and the high-end fall auction season launches tonight in NYC with art by masters such as Picasso, Degas, and Magritte for sale. Will wealthy investors bid up prices as they use art as a safe haven or will financial turmoil keep sales slow?

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • DMND

    Diamond Foods (DMND -20.2%) is slammed with three analyst downgrades following revelations that...

    Diamond Foods (DMND -20.2%) is slammed with three analyst downgrades following revelations that it was examining payments it makes to walnut growers, a process serious enough to delay its purchase of Procter & Gamble's (NYSE:PG) Pringles business until next year. BofA Merrill Lynch, RBC and Janney each take shares down a notch to their equivalent of neutral.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM | 1 Comment
  • AZPN

    Manufacturing software vendor Aspen Technology (AZPN +7.8%) closes in on its 52-week high after...

    Manufacturing software vendor Aspen Technology (AZPN +7.8%) closes in on its 52-week high after reporting FQ1 revenue of $51.2M (+19% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.09; the latter was in-line, but the former beat by $1.8M. Benchmark (Buy) is pleased with the 17% Y/Y growth in Aspen's total contract value, and management's comments about healthy customer demand. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • IPGP

    IPG Photonics (IPGP +5.3%) bounces back this morning, after falling over 5% yesterday on...

    IPG Photonics (IPGP +5.3%) bounces back this morning, after falling over 5% yesterday on cautious guidance, as Needham upgrades the stock to Buy from Hold on valuation.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • VC

    New directors nominated by activist hedge fund Alden Global are leading a push to break up...

    New directors nominated by activist hedge fund Alden Global are leading a push to break up Visteon (VC +4.3%) even though the auto parts supplier's management has argued against such a move, Reuters reports. The directors were said to have driven key decisions including hiring Goldman Sachs (NYSE:GS) as an adviser and replacing the company's CFO. (also)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • MMC

    Marsh & McLennan (MMC +2.6%) trades up after its Q3 beat estimates on strong sales growth...

    Marsh & McLennan (MMC +2.6%) trades up after its Q3 beat estimates on strong sales growth its emerging markets segment. Earnings rose 11% Y/Y, with revenue evenly distributed between the company's Risk and Insurance and Consulting businesses. Separately, Deutsche upgrades the shares to Buy, citing its strong earnings visibility.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • SKYW

    SkyWest (NASDAQ:SKYW) drops 8.5% after the airliner showed a break-even Q3 after analysts...

    SkyWest (NASDAQ:SKYW) drops 8.5% after the airliner showed a break-even Q3 after analysts expected a $0.13/share profit. The company ties the loss to higher costs and special charges it saw after acquiring ExpressJet, as well as increases in crew costs and aircraft maintenance costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • MAR

    Starwood Hotels (HOT +5.6%) shoots higher to $51 on chatter Singapore's Temasek Holdings and...

    Starwood Hotels (HOT +5.6%) shoots higher to $51 on chatter Singapore's Temasek Holdings and Thayer Lodging Group are considering bidding $65 for the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • COCO

    Corinthian Colleges (COCO +5%) ticks higher after Piper Jaffray ups the shares to Neutral. Piper...

    Corinthian Colleges (COCO +5%) ticks higher after Piper Jaffray ups the shares to Neutral. Piper says that negative enrollment and earning trends appear to be bottoming out, and the company should return to profitability over the next few quarters.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • VG

    Voice-over-IP service provider Vonage (VG -13.6%) is off sharply after reporting Q3 revenue of...

    Voice-over-IP service provider Vonage (VG -13.6%) is off sharply after reporting Q3 revenue of $216.5M (+1% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.11; the latter beat by a penny, but the former missed by $4.4M. Churn rose 20 bps Q/Q, to 2.7%, and the company  had a net loss of 9K phone lines. Vonage now expects 2011 churn of 2.6%, at the high end of its prior guidance range.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • LYG

    Lloyd's (LYG -6.2%) tumbles as its CEO Antonio Horta-Osorio takes a medical leave of absence,...

    Lloyd's (LYG -6.2%) tumbles as its CEO Antonio Horta-Osorio takes a medical leave of absence, even as an experienced replacement is already in place and Horta-Orsorio is expected to return by year's end.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • TRLG

    True Religion Apparel (TRLG +10.8%) shares gap higher after the high-end denim retailer's Q3...

    True Religion Apparel (TRLG +10.8%) shares gap higher after the high-end denim retailer's Q3 report beats profit and revenue expectations, and the company says it entered into a new distribution agreement to expand its business in China. Same-store sales open at least a year rose 10.2%. Caris says shares are a buy at current levels; Brean Murray raises its price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • GPS

    Shares of Gap (NYSE:GPS) move 2.1% higher after the company lands an upgrade from Susquehanna...

    Shares of Gap (NYSE:GPS) move 2.1% higher after the company lands an upgrade from Susquehanna from Positive to Neutral. Analysts with the firm line up a new price target of $24 - repping 28% upside potential - as they show more confidence than peers questioning Gap's "all-in" global strategy.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • IBM

    While Kenexa (KNXA +11.3%) is soaring after posting Q3 results, fellow cloud HR software firm...

    While Kenexa (KNXA +11.3%) is soaring after posting Q3 results, fellow cloud HR software firm Taleo (TLEO -2.5%) is selling off. EPS of $0.30 beat by $0.03, but revenue of $82.9M (+41% Y/Y) missed by $0.7M. Taleo's deferred revenue balance grew to $111.1M - up 41% Y/Y, but just 2% Q/Q.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • LDOS

    RBC Capital downgrades SAIC (SAI -2.2%) shares to Underperform and lowers its price target...

    RBC Capital downgrades SAIC (SAI -2.2%) shares to Underperform and lowers its price target to $12 from $13 because of exposure to a shrinking Pentagon budget. "We estimate that about 50% of SAIC sales are from non-intel/cyber related work at the DoD," Robert Stallard says. "These revenues are most likely to see both top-line and margin pressure in the coming years."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
